abstract.text: KeyboardKit helps you create fully customizable keyboard extensions, using Swift and SwiftUI.

inlineContent.text: with a few lines of code, using Swift & SwiftUI.

KeyboardKit Pro extends KeyboardKit with Pro features like localized keyboards, autocomplete, an emoji keyboard, AI support, themes, and much more. Upgrade to KeyboardKit Pro to take your keyboard extensions to the next level.
KeyboardKit Pro can be installed with the Swift Package Manager:
Unlike KeyboardKit, KeyboardKit Pro is a binary target and must ONLY be added to the app target. If you add it to any other target, it may crash at runtime.
guide helps you get started with KeyboardKit, and the
article describes the essential types in the library.
strict memory limitations that Apple puts on custom keyboards.

KeyboardKit Pro unlocks localized callouts, input sets, layouts & services for all supported locales, as shown in the
helps you build amazing keyboard extensions, and provides you with a completely free, open-source keyboard engine. You can upgrade to KeyboardKit Pro to unlock even more features.
- Define and set up your app, settings, etc.
- Identify device type, device capabilities, etc.
- Emojis, categories, versions, skin tones, etc.
- Trigger audio & haptic feedback with ease.
- Handle a rich set of gestures on any key.
- Define and customize dynamic keyboard layouts.
- Open urls and other apps from the keyboard.
- Extend the text document proxy with more capabilities.
- Provide keyboard settings & link to System Settings.
- Detect if a keyboard is enabled, has full access, etc.
- Style your keyboard to great extent.
- More essential tools, keyboard previews, etc.
- Make the keyboard view do a lot more.
- Features that are needed for AI.
- Perform autocomplete as the user types.
- Detect if an external keyboard is connected.
- Identify and open specific host applications.
- Keyboard input fields, Vietnamese support, etc.
- Localized input sets and layouts for all locales.
- Keyboard & theme previews for in-app use.
- Let the text document proxy read the entire document.
- A theme engine with many pre-defined themes.
lets you try out both KeyboardKit and KeyboardKit Pro. The
on the App Store lets you try many pro features directly on your iPhone & iPad, without having to write any code.
is a commercial, closed-source SDK that requires a license to be used.
You can purchase a KeyboardKit Pro license from the
